Welcome to Contacts Rest Api’s documentation!¶

REST API main¶

async main.custom_middleware(request: Request, call_next)¶

The custom_middleware function is a middleware function that adds the time it took to process the request to the response headers. This can be used to measure performance of an API endpoint.

Parameters:

  • request – Request: Get the request object

  • call_next – Pass the request to the next middleware in line

Returns:

A response with a header ‘performance’ that contains the time it took to process

Doc-author:

Trelent

main.healthchecker(db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The healthchecker function is a simple function that checks the health of the database. It does this by making a request to the database and checking if it returns any results. If there are no results, then we know something is wrong with our connection to the database.

Parameters:

db – Session: Get the database session from the dependency

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.limit_access_by_ip(request: Request, call_next: Callable)¶
async main.root(request: Request)¶

The root function is the main function of the application. It returns a TemplateResponse object, which renders an HTML template with data from a context dictionary. The context dictionary contains information about the request and response objects, as well as any other variables you want to pass into your templates.

Parameters:

request – Request: Get information about the request that is being made

Returns:

A template response

Doc-author:

Trelent

async main.startup()¶

The startup function is called when the application starts up. It’s a good place to initialize things that are needed by your app, such as connecting to databases or initializing caches.

Returns:

A coroutine

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create(body: ContactModel, db: Session)¶
The create function creates a new contact in the database.

It takes a ContactModel object as input and returns the newly created contact.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

The contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_birthday(db: Session)¶

The get_contact_by_birthday function returns a list of contacts whose birthday is within the next 7 days.

Parameters:

db – Session: Connect to the database and query it

Returns:

A list of contacts whose birthday is in the next 7 days

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session)¶
The get_contact_by_id function takes in a contact_id and user, and returns the contact with that id.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the desired Contact object. user (User): The User object associated with this Contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be returned

  • user – User: Get the user id from the database

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int, limit: int, user: User, db: Session)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts for the user.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip a number of contacts in the database

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • user – User: Get the user_id of the current user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts_body_field(body_field, body_param: str, user: User, db: Session)¶
The get_contacts_body_field function is a helper function that returns the contact(s) with the specified body_field

and body_param. The user parameter is used to ensure that only contacts belonging to the user are returned.

Parameters:

  • body_field – Specify the field in the contact table that is being queried

  • body_param – str: Get the value of the body field

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the user object

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the body_param

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.remove(contact_id: int, user: User, db: Session)¶
The remove function removes a contact from the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to be removed. user (User): The user who is removing the contact. db (Session): A connection to our database, used for querying and updating data.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be removed

  • user – User: Get the user’s id

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact that was removed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update_contact(contact_id: int, user: User, body: ContactModel, db: Session)¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.
Args:

contact_id (int): The id of the contact to update. user (User): The user who is updating the contact. This is used to ensure that only contacts belonging to this user are updated. body (ContactModel): A ContactModel object containing all the information for this new contact, including first name, last name, email address and telephone number.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact by id

  • user – User: Get the user_id from the user object

  • body – ContactModel: Pass the new contact information to the function

  • db – Session: Create a database session

Returns:

The updated contact

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Get the email of the user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

Nothing

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session)¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Validate the data that is passed in

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

The get_user_by_emai function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user with that email if it exists. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Filter the database for a user with that email

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object if the email is found in the database,

Doc-author:

Trelent

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • url – str: Specify the type of data that is being passed into the function

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

Trelent

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, refresh_token, db: Session)¶
The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user in the database.
Args:

user (User): The User object to update. refresh_token (str): The new refresh token to store in the database. db (Session): A connection to our Postgres SQL database.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Pass the user object to the function

  • refresh_token – Get a new access token from the spotify api

  • db – Session: Pass a database session to the function

Returns:

The user’s refresh token

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. The function then checks if there is a user with that email in our database, and if not, returns an error message. If there is a user with that email in our database, we check whether their account has already been confirmed or not.

If it has been confirmed already, we return another error message saying so; otherwise we call repository_users confirmed_email function which sets the ‘confirmed’ field of that particular User object

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A message if the email is already confirmed or confirms the email and returns a message that it has been confirmed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes the username and password from the request body, verifies them against the database, and returns an access token if successful.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Validate the request body

  • db – Session: Get a database session

Returns:

A dict with access_token, refresh_token and token_type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns an access_token, a new refresh_token, and the type of token. If the user’s current refresh_token does not match what was passed into this function then it will return an error.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the http request

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with the access_token, refresh_token and token_type

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to send an email to the user with a link that will allow them to confirm their account. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the email of the user who wants to confirm their account. It then checks if there is already an unconfirmed account associated with that email address, and if so it sends an email containing a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Get the email from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the request

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A message that will be shown to the user

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserModel object as input, which is validated by pydantic. The password is hashed using Argon2 and stored in the database. An email with an activation link is sent to the user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the request body and convert it to a UserModel object

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the server

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A UserModel object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact_by_birthday(db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contact_by_birthday function returns the contact with the closest birthday to today.

If no contacts are found, a 404 error is returned.

Parameters:

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact_by_id(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contact_by_id function is used to retrieve a contact by its id.
The function takes in the following parameters:

  • contact_id: int, the id of the contact to be retrieved.

  • db: Session = Depends(get_db), an instance of a database session that will be used for querying data from

    and persisting data into our database. This parameter is optional as it has been assigned a default value using dependency injection (i.e., Depends(get_db)). Dependency injection allows us to inject dependencies into functions without having to instantiate them

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact_id from the url

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A contact object

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(skip: int = 0, limit: int = 100, offset: int = 10, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts.
The function takes in the following parameters:

skip (int): The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set. Default is 0. limit (int): The numbers of items to return after skipping ‘skip’ items. Default is 100, max is 1000. offset (int): Used for pagination, this will determine how many pages are returned based on limit and offset values.

Parameters:

  • skip – int: Skip the first n contacts in the database

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Skip the first 10 contacts

  • db – Session: Get a database session

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A list of contacts

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_body_field(body_field, body_param: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contacts_body_field function is used to get a list of contacts from the database. The function takes in a body_field parameter, which is the field that you want to search for in the database. It also takes in a body_param parameter, which is what you are searching for within that field. The function returns an array of contacts.

Parameters:

  • body_field – Specify which field in the body of the contact you want to search for

  • body_param – str: Specify the body field that is being searched for

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • current_user – User: Get the user id of the current logged-in user

Returns:

A list of contacts that have the same value for a specified body field

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.remove_contact(contact_id: int, db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The remove_contact function removes a contact from the database.

The function takes in an integer representing the id of the contact to be removed, and returns a dictionary containing information about that contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Identify the contact to be removed

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the repository layer

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The contact that was removed

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

The function takes an id, body and db as parameters. It returns a ContactModel object.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact_id from the url

  • db – Session: Access the database

  • current_user – User: Get the current user from the database

Returns:

A ContactModel object

Doc-author:

Trelent

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_access_token function creates a new access token.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the claims to be encoded in the JWT. expires_delta (Optional[float]): An optional parameter specifying how long, in seconds, the access token should last before expiring. If not specified, it defaults to 15 minutes.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class variables and methods

  • data – dict: Pass the data to be encoded

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time for the access token

Returns:

A jwt token

Doc-author:

Trelent

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is encoded with the SECRET_KEY, which is stored in the .env file. The algorithm used to encode the token is also stored in the .env file.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the data to be encoded

Returns:

A token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶
The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.
Args:

data (dict): A dictionary containing the user’s id and username. expires_delta (Optional[float]): The number of seconds until the token expires, defaults to None.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the user’s data to be encoded

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the refresh token

Returns:

A refresh token that is encoded with the user’s id, username and email

Doc-author:

Trelent

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It takes a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if it’s valid. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail ‘Could not validate credentials’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user who is trying to refresh their access token

Doc-author:

Trelent

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

UserRouter class. It takes in a token and db session, and returns the user associated with that token. If no user is found, it raises an exception.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class variables

  • token – str: Pass the token to the function

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

The user that is currently logged in

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email associated with that token. It does this by decoding the JWT using our SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM, then checking to make sure that it has a scope of ‘email_token’. If it does, we return the email from its payload. If not, we raise an HTTPException with status code 401 (Unauthorized) and detail message ‘Invalid scope for token’. If there is any other error in decoding or validating the JWT (such as if it’s expired), we raise an HTTPException with status code 422 (Unprocessable eniity) and detail message ‘Invalid token for email verification’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that is sent to the user’s email

Returns:

The email from the token

Doc-author:

Trelent

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object, which is an instance of Flask-Bcrypt’s Bcrypt class.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Receive the password that is being hashed

Returns:

A hashed password

Doc-author:

Trelent

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed one.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • plain_password – Pass in the password entered by the user

  • hashed_password – Compare the hashed password stored in the database with a new plain text password that is entered by a user

Returns:

True if the password is correct,

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Cloud_image¶

class src.services.cloud_image.CloudImage¶

Bases: object

static generate_name_avatar(email: str)¶

The generate_name_avatar function takes an email address as input and returns a unique avatar name. The function uses the first 12 characters of the SHA256 hash of the email address to generate a unique string, which is then used as part of an avatar name.

Parameters:

email – str: Specify the type of data that will be passed into the function

Returns:

A string with the format web9/&lt;12-characters&gt;

Doc-author:

Trelent

static get_url_for_avatar(public_id, r)¶

The get_url_for_avatar function takes in a public_id and an r (which is the result of a cloudinary.api.resource call) and returns the URL for that avatar image, which will be used to display it on the page.

Parameters:

  • public_id – Identify the image in cloudinary

  • r – Get the version of the image

Returns:

A url for the avatar of a user

Doc-author:

Trelent

static upload(file, public_id: str)¶

The upload function takes a file and public_id as arguments. The function then uploads the file to Cloudinary using the public_id provided. If no public_id is provided, one will be generated automatically.

Parameters:

  • file – Upload a file to the cloudinary server

  • public_id – str: Specify the name of the image file that is uploaded to cloudinary

Returns:

A dictionary with the following keys:

Doc-author:

Trelent

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶
The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address.
The function takes in three parameters:

-email: EmailStr, the user’s email address that they entered when signing up for an account. -username: str, the username of the user who is trying to sign up for an account. This will be used in conjunction with host (see below) and token_verification (see below) as part of a URL that will be sent via email to verify their identity and allow them to access into our application.

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the recipient

  • username – str: Pass the username to the email template

  • host – str: Pass the hostname of the server to be used in the email template

Returns:

A coroutine object

Doc-author:

Trelent
